Sentencas: Carbon deposits are the most probable mode of deactivation for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFCs) using methane or higher hydrocarbons as fuel.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: The deposition of various carbon allotropes on the anode material was studied under dynamic and isothermal conditions.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: The results show methane dissociation on Ni-YSZ (nickel-yttrium stabilized zirconia) under the temperature-programmed mode in three general steps.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: Under isothermal conditions, various carbon species formed depending on the temperature.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: The presence of amorphous, filamentous, pyrolitic, and graphitic carbon allotropes was determined by quadrupole mass spectroscopy (QMS), X-ray crystallography, field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM), and infrared spectroscopy (IR).
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: Carbon allotropes were subsequently oxidized in the atmosphere with 20.0 vol% and 0.5 vol% of oxygen in argon.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon

Sentencas: Complex oxidation mechanisms were detected and discussed.
Titulo: Deactivation of Ni-YSZ Material in Dry Methane and Oxidation of Various Forms of Deposited Carbon
